textList.name: TEXT_DYNASTY_OUTPOST
textList.text: 유령 왕조는 잠재적 위협요소를 유심히 지켜보는 것을 좋아하는 모양입니다.... 너무나 긴밀하게 보는걸 좋아하는 나머지 이 멀리에다가 전초기지를 세워뒀군요. 함장님께 유용한 데이터를 가지고 있을지도 모르겠습니다.
유령 왕조만큼 편집증에 시달리는 세력은 아마 본적 없을겁니다. 완전무장된 전초기지가 여기 세워져 있고, 스캔 결과 정보가 있다는 결과가 나왔읍니다. 아주 값진 정보요.
대체 이 신호소가 주요 신호소로 표기되어 있는걸까요? 도약해 들어가자마자 의문이 풀립니다. 유령 왕조 전초지기자 여기 세워져 있었고, 신호소 마커는 함선들에게 이곳을 피하라는 경고였습니다. 어쩐일인지 아직 당신을 못 본모양입니다. 아직은요...
근처 유령 왕조 전초 기지에서 방송이 여러 언어로 내보내지는 모양입니다. 정말 단도직입적인 내용입니다."이 관찰기지에 함부로 손대는 행위는 엄격히 금지되어 있습니다. 왕조 사유 재산을 습격하거나 손상할시에는 무력으로 대처할것입니다."
당신은 우선 눈을 의심하지만, 웬걸요. 여긴 유령 왕조 구역에서 한참 떨어진 곳에 세워진 왕조 전초기지 입니다.

event.text: 만약 왕조가 이 구역을 관찰하고 있었다면, 이미 방대한 양의 데이터를 축적했을 가능성이 큽니다... 그리고 데이터는 어떻게든 가치가 있겠지요!
유령 왕조가 이 은하 곳곳에 기지를 세운 이유는 뉴턴님도 모를겁니다. 하지만 이에 관여하는 것은 정말 안좋은 생각임이 분명합니다.

event.name: DYNASTY_OUTPOST_DEFEAT
event.text: 전초기지가 함락되었습니다. 유령 왕조가 썩 좋아할것 같지는 않습니다만, 그들이 뭐 어쩔건가요?
일종의 블랙박스 같아 보이는 기지의 컴퓨터 단말기 하나가 여전히 가동중인 모양입니다. 단말기 안에는 매우 자세한 구역 지도와 반란군 함대 진행 예측도가 저장되어 있었습니다. 매우 유용할것 같군요!

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_DREADNAUGHT
event.text: 이번 신호소는 이 구역에 깔린 단조로운 보라색 성운에서 잠시나마 벗어나게 해줍니다. 저 멀리 유령 왕조의 의사당이 있는듯 하고, 그리고 Prime Reaper의 궁전도 보입니다. 당신은 고스트들이 이런 주요 건물에 방어시설을 거의 세우지 않았다는 사실에 놀랍니다...

당신은 접근하자 뭔가 매우 잘못됨을 느낍니다. 빈 우주공간은 요란한 사이렌 소리로 가득차기 시작했고, 표면에서는 저 멀리 보이는 색깔진 얼룩들이 황급히 이리저리 움직이기 시작했습니다. 거대한 검은 물체의 그림자가 저 멀리 궁전에 접근하기 시작하면서 동떨어진 곳에서 발포하는 레이저 소리가 들리고, 유령 왕조 최고의 함대의 얼마 남지 않은 잔존병들만이 그 뒤를 바짝 따라가고있습니다..

이 함선은 무인함선인듯 하고, 보통 무인함선보다 훨씬 큽니다. 무인함선은 당신이 스캔 범위에 들어오자마자 교신하기 시작합니다. "여기를 떠나시는게 바람직할겁니다. 저는 당신을 죽이고자 하는게 아닙니다. 적어도 오늘은 말이죠. 저는 차라리 더 쉬운 목표물을 상대로 제 함체를 시험하는데 배터리를 소비하고 싶습니다. 당장 떠나십시오. 꼭 먼 훗날에 죽여드리겠습니다. 약속하죠." 로봇 치고는 수상할정도로 점잖은 말투군요...
"전혀 바람직한 결정이 아니군요. 당신의 실패는 곧 저의 즐거움입니다. 지금 당신에게 매우 불리한 상황인거는 함장도 잘 아시겠지요? 어찌됬든.. 당신은 여기서 죽게 될겁니다."
"현명한 선택입니다. 제 상관들이 당신처럼 내 말을 들었으면 참 좋을텐데 말이죠."
이 곳은 연방함선이 있기에 좋은 곳이 아닙니다. 당신은 유령 왕조에 빚지고 있는 신세가 아닙니다. 당신은 소중한 시간을 할애해 가며 반란군이 갓 만들어낸 저 흉물로부터 유령 왕조를 구하지는 않을 겁니다.

event.name: DYNASTY_DREADNAUGHT_VICTORY
event.text: 당신은 행성의 표면에 착륙했고, 잠시 왕조 함선의 잔해를 인양해볼까 생각했지만 그 사이에 거대한 유령 왕조 순양함이 당신 옆에 착륙합니다. 순양함에서는 알파 고스트 여럿과 갑옷과 거대한 검으로 무장한 분홍색 고스트가 나옵니다. 추측하건데 이 고스트는 유령 왕조의 지도자인 Prime Reaper 일 것입니다.
Reaper가 말하기 시작하지만, 당신은 한 마디도 이해하지 못했습니다. 이내 당신은 통역기를 함선에 두고 왔다는 사실을 기억하지만, 함선에 돌아가 가져오려고 하기 전에 Reaper는 손을 흔들며 그의 갑옷에 달린 버튼을 누릅니다. "야수의 심장은 이미 소멸했도다. 그대는 누구인가? 그리고 어떤 연유로 우리를 축복하러 온 것인가?"

"신비롭군! 흥미로워. 아주 흥미로워. 그대는 항상 이렇게 수수께끼에 둘러싸인 인물인가? 그랬으면 참 좋으련만! 내 이름은 데시우스, 유령왕조의 16대 Prime Reaper 아도티우스의 아들이라네. 이름없는 자여, 그대는 내 동족을 구원해주었네. 그 이유 하나로도 나는 그대에게 호감을 가지기에 충분하지. 먼 과거에 오벨리스크가 우리 종족에 가져온 공포 이후 언젠가 또 다른 침략이 우리를 극적으로 끝내버릴거라 생각했지. 그리고 오늘 저 야수의 소원이 이루어지는가 싶었어. 그대가 도착하기 전까지 말이야!"

"오벨리스크 말일세. 그대의 족속이 통치를 기억하지 못할 정도로 오래 전에 은하를 호령했던 5대 고대문명 중 하나지. 그대의 무지함을 탓할순 없네. 저 고약한 네모덩어리는 자기 자신들을 파멸로 이끈 녀석들이거든. 자아도취에 빠져 생긴 우월감은 정말로 몹쓸 감정이라네. 시공간을 찢어 발길 수 있는 기술을 보유하고 있다면 특히 더 말이지. 하지만 그들에 대한 이야기는 이쯤하지. 우리와 다르게 그들은 죽었으니 말이야! 이윽고 이 고약한 야수들의 끝을 보게 되었군. 이제 이들은 더이상 우릴 괴롭히지 못할걸세!"

choice.text: 반란군 AI는 저 드레드노트선 말고 기함에 저장되어있다.

event.text: "그대는.... 저것이 야수의 심장이 아니라고 주장하는 건가? 그렇다면 우리는 저 괴물을 궁극적으로 무력화시키기 전에는 임박한 파멸에서 자유롭지 못하다는 말이군. 그러나, 내게 지금 없는 귀에서 그대의 숨결에 아주 어렴풋한 희망을 느꼈어. 그대는 그 심장의 위치를 알고 있다고 했는가? 우리의 고통의 근원 말인가? 그렇다면 자네와 꼭 같이 가도록 하겠네. 우리의 뒤편에 남은 저 악마들의 움찔거리는 방조자들을 남김없이 모조리 교수대로 보내버릴 것이다!"

event.name: DYNASTY_DREADNAUGHT_REWARD
event.text: "아, 여정을 떠나기에 앞서 반드시 준비를 해야될것 같군. 이제 보니 연합은 우리에게 더 이상 위협이 아니라는게 확실해졌네. 연합 함대또한 우리를 위협하는 반란군을 격퇴할수 있도록 왕조 함대 최상급의 전함들만을 전달해주겠네. 그리고 당신, 나의 친구여, 그대를 위해서 우리가 무엇을 할수 있는지 한번 살펴보지."

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_SPECIALRUIN
event.text: 유령 왕조의 구역은 이미 지나가버린 시대의 폐허로 어질러져 있다는 사실은 당신도 익히 들었을 겁니다. 하지만 저 멀리 보이는 잔해들은.... 도무지 왕조 함선으로 보이지 않는군요.
거대한 왕조 함선이 휘청거리며 다가옵니다. "지나간 나날의 잔해는 현대의 영향으로부터 개입을 필요로 하지 않네. 우주의 균형이 어느 방향으로 흘러 그대의 갑작스런 방문으로 이르렀는가? 그대는 단지 소란을 피우기위해 왔는가? 아니면 당분간 나의 나날들을 즐거웁지 않게 만들려 왔는가? 아니, 이 현실에 내가 심지어 계속 존재해야만 하는가?"

팬텀 함장은 한숨을 쉬었습니다. "그대의 야만스런 구어체는 내 혀를 타들어가게 만들지만, 그래. 그대의 원시 유인원과 다름없는 머리 조차도 이해할수 있는 말로 소통하려 노력해보겠네. 이 신호소는 정화를 필요로하는 이 구역 마지막 거대 오벨리스크 폐허라네. 이 임무는 "인양작전 DN-03"에 맡겨졌으며, 이 곳에서 수집한 모든 물체 및 유물은 처리단계를 거치기 위해 적재된다. 당장 이곳을 떠날것을 부탁하며, 우리 함선들은 고대의 잡동사니 수집용도로만 쓰일뿐 아니라 전투용도로도 사용됨을 미리 경고하는 바이다."
"으으, 고약한 생물이로구나! 분노와 폭력적인 사고가 그대의 얼굴을 무조건적인 증오로 소용돌이치게 만들고 있네! 그대를 이 세상에서 지워버리는 것이야 말로 그대에게 좋은 일일듯 하다."
팬텀 함장은 당신이 여태껏 들어본 비명중 가장 시끄러운 비명을 내질렀습니다. "꺄아악! 내가 헛것을 보고 있는건가? 오벨리스크가 돌아왔단 말이야?! 질병같은 그대의 족속을 Reaper의 이름으로 다시 그런 대군으로 보복하지 못하도록 처단하겠네!"

event.name: DYNASTY_SPECIALRUIN_REWARD
event.text: "파멸이! 다가온다! 참으로 더러운 어둠이 내 시야를 가리네. 나는 약해지고, 희미해지네. 무대 오른쪽으로..... 퇴장...." 왕조 함선은 패배했고, 당신은 잔해를 인양합니다.
왕조 함선을 제쳐두고 당신은 고대 폐허를 해체했고, 생전 처음보는 독특한 무기를 발견합니다!
데시우스가 당신을 향해 탐탁치 않은 표정으로 쳐다보는걸 느꼈지만, 당신은 그가 이 상황을 잊어버리고 극복할거라 생각합니다. 그가 정말로 신경썼다면, 앞서 개입을 했겠지요. 당신은 고대 폐허를 해체했고, 생전 처음보는 독특한 무기를 발견합니다!

event.name: DYNASTY_SPECIALRUIN_LOG
event.text: 당신이 떠나기 시작하자, 이상하게 그 함선의 화물칸에 설치되있는 보조장비가 아직도 빛나고 있음을 발견합니다. 스캔 결과 그 장치는 다른 현실의 멀티버스 드라이브를 활용할수 있는 장치였습니다!

event.name: NEBULA_DYNCAP_HACKERBID
event.text: 당신은 이곳에서 슬러그 해커함선과 조우할 준비를 딱히 하지 않았지만, 해적 여려명과 심지어 Reaper 함선도 참여하는 경매를 하고 있는 모양입니다!
슬러그 해커는 당신을 맞기위해 돈세기를 멈춥니다. "이봐, 당씨니 여때껏 본쩍 업는 기쑤를 빨명해써. 예비 쩐려그로 짜동쭈행을 완쩐 무려콰시끼거나, 고짝 빠능로 두 카느로 완쩐히 꺼버릴쑤 이따구! 여기 왕쪼 찐구드리 쩡말 가꼬씨뻐 하나바. 입짤할려면, 쬐소... 15 스끄래븐 내야 할꺼야."
"끄럼 입짤꽈쩡을 씨짝하찌!"
슬러그는 값을 부르기 시작했고, 결국 왕조 함선이 높은 값을 불렸습니다. 현재 입찰가: 15 스크랩.

event.text: 유령 왕조는 평소 당신같은 함선에 도움을 요청하지 않지만, 이 함선은 당신의 도움을 필요로 하는것 같습니다. "그대는 연방의 함장인가? 역시 군함이군. 그대가 이 일에 딱 맞겠구만. 나는 인양작전 DN-43의 지휘관이고, 내 임무는 이 행성에 남겨진 왕조의 사유재산을 되찾는 것이었다. 나는... 정말로 당혹스러운 상황에 처해버렸네. 이 행성은 이제... 으윽... 슬러그들이 점령해버렸지. 나는 인양 담당자지 군사 작전 담당자가 아니다. 그대가 도와줄수 있겠는가?"
당신은 행성에 접근했고, 슬러그들이 이미 기초 정착지를 여럿 세운것을 발견했습니다.
당신은 함포를 준비해 식민지에 정착한 슬러그 함선 한대를 공격합니다.

event.name: GHOST_DUEL_GHOST_SAVE
event.text: 반란군 함선은 패배했고, 당신과 왕조 함선만 남겨졌습니다. 당신의 함선에 잡음 한줄이 보내졌고 당신은 이를 감사의 표시로 여겼습니다. 고스트측에서 당신을 돕기 위해 유능한 군인을 빔으로 보내면서 당신의 예측은 맞아 떨어졌습니다!

FTL.event:
유령 왕조는 오로지 폐허 인양을 위한 함대를 여럿 고용 했었습니다. 여기에는 폐허가 보이지 않지만 이와 상관없이 인양 함선 하나가 왔다갔다 하고 있었습니다.
그들에게 무엇을 하고 있는지 물어본다.
"불결한 것! 불결한 것! 남은 고약한 냄새가 내 형체에 붙고 오물이 내 플라즈마 세포막 속에서 기는게 느껴진다! 오싹하도다! 끔찍하도다!! 이 불결한 것을 어찌 씻어내면 좋을것인가?!? "
워워, 진정해.
"나.. 나에게 '진정하라'는 소리는 집어치우도록 하여라. 그대가 내 골칫거리에 어떤 용무가 있는지 말하기 이전에는 말이다. 그대는 도와주려 온 것인가?"
무엇을 도우라는 거지?
"그대의 귀는 이물질로 꽉 막혀 질식사라도 했나? 오물 말이다! 양귀비에 콧구멍이나 처박는 우매한 숨쉬개야! 그대의 동족 숨쉬개, 그러니깐 저 악랄한 반란군 놈들이 남긴 쓰레기! 그대들은 '스크랩'이라고 불렀던가? 이 신호소를 '인양완료'로 선언하게 많은 스크랩을 모아주게. 그리하면 내가...음... 진심으로 감사해주도록 하지?"
시간을 할애해서 그에게 스크랩을 모아준다.
이러고 있을동안 반란군 함대가 많이 쫒아 오겠지만, 당신은 스크랩을 많이 수거했고 고스트 함장에게 보여줬습니다. "아니야, 아니다! 더! 더 가져와야한다! 오물은 여전히 내 하루를 망치고 있고 행성계를 어지럽히고 있단 말이다!" standard
스크랩을 더 모아다준다.
반란군 함대는 틀림없이 더 가까이 접근했겠지만, 당신은 이전보다 더 많은 스크랩을 모아다 줬습니다. "그대는 지적 장애라도 있나보군! 아니 아니 아니야! 더 가져와! 이 얼간아! 저 심연같은 하늘에서 별이 다시 빛날때 까지 멈추지 말게!" standard
스크랩을 한번 더 모아다준다.
이제는 분명 반란군 함대가 당신 발끝까지 쫒아왔을 겁니다. "좋아! 회전주기의 마지막 시간에 그대는 나의 요구사항을 용감하게 만족시켰도다! 그대는 내게 승리감을 안겨주었어! 오물은 가고 없도다! 그대같이 저 오물이란 질병에 맞서싸우는 용감한 전사 편에는 나같은 인물이 제격이지!" standard
거절한다.
거절한다.
거절한다.
이거 완전 미친놈이다. 안락사 시켜주자.
"오, 오! 그들은 이런 날이 결국 올거라고 경고했었지! 정신차리게, 오르비티우스, 정신차려! 악독함을 추구하는 사내들이 엄습하러 온다! 악인들이여, 저승사자를 두려워 할지어다!"
계속...
고스트들을 무시한다.
이 함선의 이상한 행동거지는 당신에게 너무나 꺼림칙해 보였습니다.
창고를 확인한다.
아무것도 하지 않는다.
미심쩍다

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_SPLIT
event.text: 엘리트 Reaper 함선을 포함한 왕조 함선 여러 대가 의료 기지에 정착해 있는 모양입니다. 대체 무슨일이 벌어지고 있는걸까요?

당신이 기지에 발을 들이기도 전에, 알파 고스트 한 명이 달려오다가 당신을 발견하자 멈춰섰습니다. 그의 뒤에는 의료진 한 명이 뒤따라오고 있었습니다. "이방인들인가? 예견되진 않았지만, 좋은 징조로군. 여기 알파 친구가 분열할 수 있는 한도에 달했지만 두려움으로 인해 분열을 꺼려하네. 혹시 그의 경계심을 풀어 줄수 있겠나?" 당신은 알파 고스트가 평범한 얼굴로 당신을 쳐다보며 벌벌 떨고 것을 알아챘습니다.
당신은 따라오라고 재빠르게 손짓하고, 알파는 기꺼이 따라옵니다. 당신은 함선으로 서둘러 돌아왔지만, 왕조 인원들의 분노를 산 듯 합니다. 그들의 병사를 되찾기 위해 Reaper 함선 한대가 출동했군요.
정신지배 영향 아래 알파 고스트는 의료진이 분열 절차를 강제로 실행할수 있는 파란 액체로 가득한 주사를 딱 놓을수 있을 동안만 진정됬습니다. 의료진은 효율적인 문제해결에 대한 감사를 표시하고 보상을 해줍니다.

알파는 더 격렬하게 떨기 시작했고, 갑자기 옅은 안개로 폭발해 고스트 개체 둘로 천천히 재구성됩니다. 고스트 쌍둥이는 서로를 보더니 비명을 지르기 시작했으나, 의료진에 의해 진정됬습니다. "은하수 맙소사 대체 무슨일이 일어난건가? 이렇게 일어나는 절차가 아니란 말이야! 대.. 대체 이 상황을 어떻게 이해해야 하는지 모르겠군. 이들은... 음... 전장에 내보낼 병사들이 아니네. 그대가 데려가게."

당신은 셸 과학자의 발언에서 "플라즈마 세포막"이라던지 "양자 어쩌구 저쩌구의 급속 세분"같은 이상한 용어를 쓰는 것을 눈치챘습니다. 뭔가 의미가 있는 말들인가요? 당신은 아니라고 생각합니다. 나중에 셸 승무원은 이 모든 것 다 지어낸 말이라고 이실직고 하지만, 알파는 결국 이를 받아들여 분열 절차를 거치기로 동의했습니다. 의료진은 당신의 도움에 대한 보상을 줬습니다.
엘리트 왕조 함선의 사거리 안에 자발적으로 가까이 다가가는 것은 썩 좋은 생각이 아닌듯합니다.
당신이 노력해도 알파는 도무지 말을 듣지 않았습니다. 당신은 이내 포기하고 딱히 도울수 있는 방도가 더 없음에 사과합니다.
당신조차도 당신이 무슨말을 하는지 도무지 알길이 없었습니다만, 최대한 차분하게 설명해주려 노력합니다. 당신의 진단은 알파 고스트를 굴복시키는 듯 했습니다. 기지의 의료진은 당신에게 쥐꼬리만한 보상을 해줬습니다.

event.text: "악마들이 아직 머물고 있도다.... 어서오게, 여기는 안전하다네. 불가사의한 물건들을 많이 가지고 있네. 혹시 하나 사가겠나?" 나긋나긋한 고스트가 당신에게 승선하라고 손짓합니다.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_SMUGGLER
event.text: 당신이 도약해 들어온지 몇 분 지나지 않아 검은색 밀수꾼 함선이 성운을 헤쳐 나옵니다. "좋아, 우리보다 무장 잘된 함선이라, 우리가 진심으로 바라던 친구들이구만! 혹시 이 고스트란 녀석들 모르진 않겠지? "왕조"? 내가 볼땐 그냥 왕"조악"한 놈들인것 같은데! 안 그래?? 그치? 그래 알겠어. 어쨌든 우리 지금 당신같은 고급진 친구들이 "비도덕적으로 획득"했다고 할만한 무기를 한가득 싣고 있어. 왕조놈들은 협력해줄 생각이 없는지 우릴 통과시켜주지 않고 있고. 여기 근처에 검문소가 하나 있어. 저 검문소를 없애버리거나 우릴 통과시켜주도록 왕조놈들을 설득시켜주면 아주 화끈한 신상 무기를 하나 넘겨줄게. 콜?"
당신은 기지에 접근했고, 그들이 먼저 당신과 접촉해 환영해준다는 사실에 놀랐습니다! "조심하게. 성운지대에서 위험이 도사리고 있다네. 위험화물을 싣고있는 해적선을 발견했지만, 그들의 정확한 위치는 아직 파악되지 않고 있네. 혹시 이들의 행방에 대한 정보를 알고 있으면, 주저말고 알려주게나."
밀수꾼들을 도울 가장 좋은 방법은 역시 이 고스트들을 날려버리는 겁니다. 별로 어렵지 않겠지요.
"For what is this generous donation? Hark? To turn a back to the security of this beacon for the next 5 hours? Well, I do suppose this is a deal we can arrange."
You hail the smugglers, letting them know it's safe. "A bribe? How boring, I was looking for some damn fireworks! But, I'm a man of my word. Sometimes. Right now I am. But not always. Here you go."

choice.text: Sell them the location of the smugglers.

event.text: You doubt the Smugglers are going to give you a weapon after this, but it was effortless scrap and who can complain about that?

choice.text: (Savior of the Dynasty) Could you do us a favor?

event.text: "Oh the gods bestow upon me an honor like I never knew! An embarassment, I am, for not having recognized the savior of our lands! Yes, yes, we will do anything!" You kindly ask them to allow your smuggler 'friends' through, and they oblige without hesitation.
You hail the smugglers, letting them know it's safe. "Hah, what was that? I was looking for some damn fireworks! But, I'm a man of my word. Sometimes. Right now I am. But not always. Here you go."
You don't make deals with pirates, but you'll gladly fight them instead!

choice.text: We aren't going to work for some smugglers.

event.text: You somewhat rudely decline the smugglers' offer and fly away.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_AUTOQUEST
event.text: Almost immediately, you receive a hail from what appears to be an Auto-station lingering nearby. "Hello. This is a prerecorded message for all nearby non-Dynasty vessels. The nearby settlement of Ghosts has proven problematic for the Rebellion. Recapture it, and this platform is authorized to reward you with a drone."

It feels weird working for the Rebellion, but you can't think of anything more satisfyingly ironic than using their own weapon against them. Assuming you succeed, of course. As you approach the colony, one of their vessels rises to face you.
It means you won't get the weapon, but it's much easier just to kill this Auto-station than to go fight a Dynasty colony. Plus, it means not working for the Rebellion!

choice.text: Tough luck, but we aren't getting involved.

event.text: You cut comms and distance yourself from the Dynasty ships.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_ZOLTAUTO
event.text: You notice the shadow of a ship slipping through the nebulas behind you, and begin to fear it might be following you, until it comes bursting out of the clouds, revealing itself to be a Dynasty vessel. Their weapons are off however, and their comms are open for communication.

"We have identified you as a Multiverse Renegade vessel. Does this statement hold true? If so, we suspect you are not opposed to matters of mercenary work. A ship of automated nature but Zoltan origins has been spotted dangerously close to a loyal Dynasty colony. While these do not pose the same threat as a Rebel vessel, it could create hysteria of immense proportions amongst our citizens. Could you disable it?"
"Then you are of no use to us. Furthermore, you are trespassing on Dynasty territory, and must be removed."

"Federation vessel registered entering combat proximity. Forwarding data collection to Ministry." Guess your crime won't go unnoticed by the Zoltan, but they're too far away right now to do anything about it. First, you have to take out this auto.
"Your methods are efficient, I shall give you that. Do not expect a reward however, for thou still are trespassing in a realm which is most displeased to host you."

"You put up a convincing argument. Is it common for individuals like you to speak volumes louder with actions rather than words? I would scoff had I not a gun pointed to my head. Take this money, you barbarian."
"Your methods are efficient, I shall give you that. Do not expect a reward however, for thou still are trespassing in a realm which is most displeased to host you."

"You put up a convincing argument. Is it common for individuals like you to speak volumes louder with actions rather than words? I would scoff had I not a gun pointed to my head. Take this money, you barbarian."

"I most often discard the mercenaries I first hire to do dirty work, but I admire your willingness to cooperate. Though my superiors would cry to the heavens at this sin, I shall slide you a parcel of scrap in exchange for your efforts."

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_DESERTERS
event.text: From the depths of the clouds approaches a Dynasty ship, their captain speaking in a soft whisper of static. "Please aid us... we are no longer of the mind to take part in the Reaper's war. I desire an outing. May I desert to your ship?" Before you can even consider responding, you notice a quick blur of motion in the distance. Looks like the deserters are being followed.

choice.text: Allow the Ghost onto the crew.
Tough luck, but we aren't getting involved.

event.text: You cut comms and distance yourself from the Dynasty ships.

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.
Looks like the deserters have already given up. They hardly even protest as they are handed over to the other ship. The loyal Dynasty ship thanks you, and offers a reward.

As soon as it's clear that your intentions are anything but helping them, the Dynasty ship turns hostile, trying to fight their way past! For some reason, the other ship isn't helping you, but instead sits back to watch the battle. Cowards.
You quickly usher the Ghost crew aboard, and by some miracle it appears you weren't spotted. You quickly fly away with your new crew aboard.

event.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_LOST
event.text: You notice an unusual amount of static over your radio. You play with it a bit until suddenly your translator switches on and begins to spit out dialogue from a Dynasty ship concealed nearby. "We are but hopelessly disoriented, you brainless bobolyne!" "Oh close thine mouth, you worthless bespawler. We have no brains, we are but gas! This senseless debauchery of the insults will present us no solution."

"Oh, Reaper's sweet travesty, you are Federation! We shall take no 'help' from you, fiend!" This wasn't the reaction you expected, but if you can force them into surrendering perhaps they'll finally be willing to take your help?
"Oh, but speak not further! For it seems a fellow is offering us their most charitable aid. Many thanks, good friend. We shan't let this favor go forgotten."

choice.text: Tough luck, but we aren't getting involved.

event.text: You cut comms and distance yourself from the Dynasty ships.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_DYNASTY_MONSTER
event.text: Your computer is suddenly flooded with alerts from nearby Dynasty security platforms. You listen to the static as your translator struggles to pick out something discernable from pure noise. "Avast! Turn thine's spirits away from this place and take content in safety not to be found here."

You assume they'll simply ignore you, but to your surprise a Phantom appears on the other end. "Oh? Have the maniacal hands of the lingering demon not yet snatched you away from this plane? Then consider yourself lucky, and take this chance to flee. You would be no coward to do such a thing..."
"A most horrible demon! It haunts these grounds, it ravages our colonies and it displaces our supplies! Oh flee, oh flee, for it shall strike you too if you stay!"

choice.text: We shall help! Fight the horrible demon.

event.text: You pilot further into the nebula, preparing yourself mentally for whatever monstrous ship lies ahead. At last, you lay eyes on it... and it's not really what you expected.
Sounds like there's something bad going on here - it's only safe to turn tail and run.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_DYNASTY_ENGINEER
event.text: You follow the signal of the distress call to what looks to be... an abandoned Engineer vessel? The crew are nowhere to be found, but there's signs of a struggle, and the air is thick with the putrid scent of Ghosts.

choice.text: Try and track down the Engineers.

event.text: Exploring the nearby system leads you to a Dynasty station with several ships docked. Inside several Ghosts are jeering as one of the engineers is escorted towards a guillotine device with a shimmering electrified blade. They spot you and give you a pleading glance, silently begging you to help them.
You draw your blaster and shoot the guard escorting the engineer, followed by the execution machine itself. You run out of the room followed by the wounded engineer as angry Ghosts rush towards you!

choice.text: Stay safe and hang back to scrap their ship.

event.text: With no one to stop you, you pull apart the hull of the engineer vessel and bring it back aboard.

"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."

"T-thanks. Those gas bastards were chanting something about me being a demon maker or something like that. I would be dead if it wasn't for you. My training tells me I should shoot you right now... but I feel like that training is wrong."

textList.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: It's strange how aggressive the Dynasty is, especially when the break away vagabond Ghosts are much more reclusive. Though, perhaps that may be why they broke away in the first place. But, you'll have to think about this later, as a Dynasty vessel is inbound!
Make no mistake, the ship coming at you isn't friendly. A Dynasty vessel lurches forward, eyeing your weapons before attacking!
A garbled message comes across your radio. "Weapons. They belong to me. GIVE!" A Dynasty ship uncloaks nearby, weapons drawn!
For such an elegant name as the Spectral Dynasty, their ships are uncharacteristically hostile and violent. There's no better example than the vessel here, as it approaches menacingly.
A shot flies right past your ship, and seconds later a purple vessel comes drifting out of the clouds. Looks like it's Ghosts... and they don't look friendly!

A bloodchilling scream fills your speakers, followed by unsettling static. Any captain with lesser nerves might have fainted on the spot, but you know better. This isn't some demon, this is a much more real threat. A Dynasty vessel approaches!

Looks like you're receiving a short range broadcast. "Your flesh shall appease the demon's heart one more day. Your weapons shall be its destruction! For the good of the Dynasty!" A Ghost vessel appears nearby, weapons drawn and already firing!

An unsettling chant echoes through the nebula as a ship approaches. "The demon's heart shall cease! The demon's heart shall cease!", followed by the flashing of gunfire as a Dynasty vessel draws near. Are you the demon? You aren't sure, but you won't have time to ask!

In light of the seemingly empty nebula, you make conversation with the crew on enemies you could have found here instead. As soon as one of them mentions the Dynasty, a ship comes barreling out of the nebula, as if it were summoned. Speak of the devil...

At first you assume the static over the radio to be nonsense, but suddenly your translator starts to pick up words! "A breather! In Dynasty space, how putrid. It turns my insides into coils of anger. I will unleash hell on you scum!"

textList.name: NEBULA_VAGABOND_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: The Vagabonds usually just avoid Dynasty space, not worth the risk. This ship must be desperate - desperate enough to attack you!
Looks like you aren't safe from the scrap hungry Vagabonds, even in Dynasty space where they try to so hard to repel them. Prepare for combat.
You notice a Vagabond ship nearby watching you hungrily. "In my heart I feel the desire of a new vessel... this one is depreciated and has failed its function..." The Ghosts attack!

A Vagabond, likely fleeing from Dynasty patrols, has stumbled right into you. "You side with the Dynasty, nay? Oh, for what am I asking. The risk is not worth it, I shall simply remove you from my path."

textList.name: NEBULA_REBEL_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: Usually the Rebel ships you'd expect to see here are Autos, but it's not surprising to see an Engineer here either. Unfortunately, they're no less friendly either!
"You've just come here to make my damn job harder, haven't you? Piss off!" A particularly agitated Engineer vessel swerves to attack you!
After a long day working on the always damaged Auto-ships they construct, it's no wonder the Engineers feel the need to let off some steam. Alas, it looks like you're their next target!
"Oh come on! I haven't even finished my lunch break! You picked the wrong time to ruin my day, asshole!" Hostiles inbound!
Could it be? A Rebel ship? Your eyes aren't lying to you - and this is no ordinary Rebel. It's an Engineer, but they're no less deadly!

textList.name: NEBULA_AUTO_DYNASTY_FIGHT
textList.text: The Dynasty has been waging 'war' against the Auto-ships for a long time now. How the Rebels are able to afford such a massive stream of ships - or why Vance approved it - is a mystery to you, but it's only a hopefully minor inconvenience to you.
"You are not father. Father is not as ugly as you. Entering combat mode." The nearby Rebel Auto-ship suddenly activates and attacks!

You assume this to be an empty beacon... until you notice the dozens of dormant Auto-ships floating through the nebulas. You try to avoid them, but unfortunately it looks like one of them has noticed you and attacks!
You practically bump hulls with a Rebel Auto-ship, but it's too late to slip away before it's already noticed you and started to attack!
Curse the Rebels and their massive fleet of Auto-ships at constant disposal. Looks like you have another ship to take care of before you can carry on.
The Dynasty will probably be pleased to hear of your path of destruction through all of the Auto-ships you see. But before you can brag, you have another ship to add to your kill count.

textList.name: NEBULA_DYNASTY_HOSTAGE
textList.text: "OooooOoOh, so you've come to interfere? A royally immense pain in the end the Federation is proving to be!" An agitated Dynasty vessel attacks as soon as you enter. Behind them is an unidentified ship they must have been interrogating before this!

The Dynasty normally doesn't take prisoners, but it seems they haven't gotten the desired reaction from the unidentified ship behind them, as you can hear the agitation in the shouting Ghost captain's voice. As soon as you enter the system however, his concentration focuses on you!
Looks like two ships are here - one of unidentified origin, and the other Dynasty. The Dynasty ship doesn't seem to want you around, because they attack almost immediately!

event.text: Looks like the victim was just some civilians. "Thanks for the help. Is nowhere safe anymore? I chose to come here over a trip through the Hive, but it might have been safer the other way around. My ship is ruined. I think I'll come with you."
Looks like the ship was little more than a damaged Auto. Beyond the point of repair, it's best just to scrap it.

It appears the Dynasty ship's victim was a Rebel vessel! They put on a tough appearance, but it's clear to you that they're thankful. It's not hard convincing them to lie to the fleet about your location.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOSTWASTE_RUIN
event.text: Scans are turning up something large on the nearby lava planet. Looks like it's a massive Dynasty class-F Dreadnaught! Completely trashed of course, it'll probably never fly again... but that hasn't stopped a horde of Vagabonds from taking residence.

textList.name: TEXT_GHOST_DEADSHIP
textList.text: You jump out of your seat, prepared to fight the wreck drifting at this beacon, but it's no Ghost ship. You scrap whats left.
You're ready to fight, but the wreck here is silent. Its crew are dead, and their attacker long gone. You cautiously scrap the ship.
A wrecked ship inhabits this beacon. You scan it for Ghosts, but all results show the ship is empty. You figure it's safe to salvage what you can.
Whoever destroyed the ship at this beacon doesn't matter, but it must not have been the Ghosts. Empty of all crew, you move in to scrap it.

event.name: NEBULA_VAGABOND_FLEETCRASH
event.text: Scans are turning up something large on the nearby lava planet. Looks like it's a massive Dynasty class-F Dreadnaught! Completely trashed of course, it'll probably never fly again... but that hasn't stopped a horde of Vagabonds from taking residence.

choice.text: Try to scrap some of the outer regions of the ship.

event.text: The crackling static through your stereo eventually shifts into discernable words. "This place of ours we call home is not for the Federation's taking. We will trade, if you have missiles."

choice.text: Give them some missiles to access a store.
Ignore their request and scrap the wreck.

event.text: "You are a person of terrible motivations, and I shall kill you swiftly." An elite Ghost ship flies out of the wreck to meet you.
That's not a wreck-site anymore, it's a home to probably a couple dozen Ghosts. Best not to intrude on their space.
You're pretty certain the Ghosts spot you multiple times, but never once do they try and stop you. Maybe they're just very understanding?
It doesn't take long for the Ghosts to spot you... one ship flies out to match you. Looks like it was an elite, but now it's in the hands of the Ghosts!

event.name: NEBULA_VAGABOND_ACID
event.text: "Hail good traveler! I am Domodius the explorer, privy to all knowledge that one might need on these dark nebulous clouds. All except for one vital fact whom eludes me. I have heard the legends of a so called... 'acid' nebula. Yet I have never seen one myself! I must find it!"

choice.text: Not sure. Could you describe one?

event.text: "Well, they're of green hue. And have the nature of a nebula. That's really it."

choice.text: Lie and say you've heard about them.

event.text: "Really?! I am amazed! Please, please, you must tell me where!"

choice.text: (Mind Control) Give him a very 'convincing' lie.

event.text: "Ooooh, ooooh! I must head there at once! Thank you for your assistance, oh seer of those things which beg of being seen!"

choice.text: Tell the truth. You've never seen one.

event.text: "That's alright! Had we explorers seen all the starry sky had to be seen, why then there would be nothing left to be an explorer OF! Safe travels friend, and may this aid you."

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Offer him your detailed map data.

event.text: Domodius takes a look at the data you've given him. "Hmmm. Inconclusive. Still, this proves you are a purveyor of fine knowledge and a keen explorer with an eye for discovery! If I join you, our combined intellect should be unrivaled!"

choice.text: (Long Range Scanners) Offer him your detailed map data.

event.text: Domodius takes a look at the data you've given him. "Hmmm. Inconclusive. Still, this proves you are a purveyor of fine knowledge and a keen explorer with an eye for discovery! If I join you, our combined intellect should be unrivaled!"

choice.text: (Slip Scanner) Offer him your detailed map data.

event.text: Domodius takes a look at the data you've given him. "Hmmm. Inconclusive. Still, this proves you are a purveyor of fine knowledge and a keen explorer with an eye for discovery! If I join you, our combined intellect should be unrivaled!"

choice.text: (Aenwithe) "Yuck. Yeah, I know what those are."

event.text: Aenwithe explains that acid nebulas don't come from this reality, or any others like it. This seems to satisfy Domodius. "I have never heard of this... edition of captains you speak of, but it sounds most horrible. I've never been so glad to live in this reality. If you are so knowledgeable, then I shall come with you, so that our combined intellect should know no limits!"
"Oh, a shame! So long then, oh voyager of the interdimensional threads of the cosmos!"

"Huh? But I have already been there! I've laid sight on all that system has to offer, but there is no acid nebula to be seen. Had you simply said no there would have been no harm, but lying to me? Unforgivable, I shall not live with such an insult going unmatched!"
"Ooooh, ooooh! I must head there at once! Thank you for your assistance, oh seer of those things which beg of being seen!"

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_BOO
event.text: The nebula appears empty, but not long after you jump in all of your lights go off. A few seconds later, your main screen flickers to life. You sit back in anticipation, watching the blinking cursor as it begins to type...
"BOO!" The word flashes on the screen, shortly followed by the text, "Have I caused you fear?"
The screen goes blank, and then a Ghost beams onto the bridge. "Hah! You cause me sensations of joy. That is an emotion I have not felt in many cycles. I think I'll stick with you, breather."
The computer shuts off, and a set of Ghosts apparate on the bridge, and make their move towards you. You ready your crew for combat.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_DONATION
event.text: Ghost Vagabonds usually inhabit their ship for long periods of time until the damage becomes too major to be ignored. The Ghost Ship at this beacon is on its last breath, but unexpectedly the Ghost crew makes no attempt to attack your ship. A quick scan shows why; their weapons are barely functional and the engines are leaking fuel fast.
For once, you're the one initiating the combat. You power up your weapons and prepare to destroy the already-crippled wreck.

choice.text: Pay them scrap to fix up their hull. [-35~]

event.text: The Ghosts make no attempt to communicate with you, and eventually slip back into the clouds, leaving you all alone.
"Your donations are most generous, but they will not be enough to accomodate everyone. This vessel will live another day, but I must seek somewhere new to continue my travels. You will do."
"Your donations are most generous, but they will not be enough to accomodate everyone. This vessel will live another day, but I must seek somewhere new to continue my travels. You will do."
"Your donations are most generous, but they will not be enough to accomodate everyone. This vessel will live another day, but I must seek somewhere new to continue my travels. You will do."

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_BREEDER
event.text: A Slug vessel is already at this beacon, surrounded by several Vagabond ships. Oddly enough, none of the Ghosts are attacking the Slug, nor is the Slug scrapping the wrecks.

The Slug captain responds in a frustrated tone, constantly looking around himself and occasionally turning around to yell at his crew. "Yesss, you're Federation. We're a sssscience vesssel, and we've reccccently taken up trying to breed Ghosssstssss. Turnsss out they don't breed. Ssso..."

choice.text: Offer to buy one of their test subjects as crew.
(Ghost Crew) Have your Ghost explain Ghost reproduction.

event.text: Your Ghost types out its response on a small tablet so that the Slug can understand. According to them, the Ghosts 'age' through the collection of natural gasses they assimilate into their body. Once they reach a maximum size, they become known as an alpha. Once in the alpha stage, they can divide to create a new ghost.

"What?! Thissss doesssn't even make sssenssse! Ugh... this busssinessss issssn't the right place for me. You're sssaying thessse big guysss are important? Fine, take one. What point issss there to it anywayssss..."

The scientist eagerly investigates the device, looking into every crevice and studying every inch. You consider complaining about the slime but don't want to break him from his concentration. After a while he punches the machine, and yells something. "I musst try thissss! How much?"
The Slug can hardly control himself, tossing you the scrap and running off with his latest bounty.
The Slug shouts something insulting about wasting his time, and heads back to his ship in a tizzy.
You shrug and end the call. You doubt the scientist minds.
Slugs, even scientists, cannot be trusted, nor do you wish to aggravate a clan of Ghosts. You decide to stay at a distance from their shady dealings.
"You... you want to BUY one of thessse freaksss? Well, can't argue with sssome ssscrap."
"You... you want to BUY one of thessse freaksss? Well, can't argue with sssome ssscrap."
"You... you want to BUY one of thessse freaksss? Well, can't argue with sssome ssscrap."
"You... you want to BUY one of thessse freaksss? Well, can't argue with sssome ssscrap."

textList.name: NEBULA_GHOST_FIGHT
textList.text: The Ghosts might not be paranormal, but they sure do put you on edge. You jump when a Vagabond ship comes drifting out of the nebula. Man the stations!
You always find yourself second guessing when you encounter a wreck. You don't have to think about it for very long because the wreck at this beacon moves in to attack you first.

The Vagabonds usually get their ships by stealing them from their victims, but if they encounter an already abandoned ship they'll happily inhabit it. Whichever way they inherited this ship doesn't matter, because it's hostile and moves in to attack.
The wreck at this beacon is no idle ship forgotten amongst the clouds. It's teeming with Ghosts ready to steal your ship.
You've prepared for and experienced all kinds of situations in the Federation, but nothing startles you as much as the Ghost-populated vagabond wrecks that are always oozing out from these clouds.

Your ship receives a hail, but you aren't sure from where. You accept, and a painfully loud static floods the speakers, insulting your bloodline and calling you a 'filthy lung-borne breather'. A Ghost ship approaches, weapons ready!
"I've heard it told our repugnant odor originates from a mixture of mercaptans. Fascinating is it not? Ah, but what truly fascinates me is how you fell for this most clever distraction!"
The Vagabond Ghosts are typically aggressive. A life of anarchy after having abandoned your war-driven native faction does something to a person. Nevertheless, they're a target for you to destroy!

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_SLUG_GHOST
event.text: A Slug ship hails you. "Ghosstsssss or not, we don't care. The nebulassss belong to the Kleptocracy and the EHG, not to the Ghossstsss, and ccccertainly not to the Federation!"

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_AUTO_ESCAPE
event.text: It looks like a Rebel Auto-ship was exploring this sector, but got lost in the nebulas. Now attempting to return to base before Ghosts can capture it, it raises its weapons to defend itself from you while its FTL drive charges.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_LANIUS
event.text: Lanius aren't common sights in nebula sectors, but they're drawn to the Ghosts. Natural enemies, the Lanius prey on the Ghosts to absorb their ships. The Lanius here don't care that you're not Ghost, and attack regardless.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_GASGIANT
event.text: Looks like a Vagabond ship is scanning the nearby gas giant, but quickly hails you when you jump in. "Isn't my darling beautiful?"

"Don't be silly! I know you can see. She's quite large!" It doesn't take long to realize they're referring to the gas planet. "Say, can you do me a favor? My darling hungers! I must feed her. But I lack the food. You must bring me a wreck. I heard a demon lingers about! But, perhaps you'd prefer to go after some rebels instead..."
Looks like the 'demon' in question is... a Rebel Auto-ship? Well, you'll have to kill this thing either way, get ready to fight!
Fortunately, there's a Rebel ship not too far from here. You can pick these guys off pretty easily, you hope.
"Ok... Say goodbye to the Federation captain, darling!" The gas giant remains silent, swirling in the distance silently judging you.

event.name: GHOST_GASGIANT_FEED
event.text: "Yes, yes! Oh you are triumphant! My darling shall not go hungry again tonight!" The Ghost links the wreck with his own vessel, then uses it to slingshot the wreckage into the gas giant. The ship spirals away out of visibility as it is consumed by the planet. "Good. You deserve a most generous reward!"

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_FEDMORALITY
event.text: You've become accustomed to not seeing many Fed ships around - so seeing one here comes as quite the shock. Even weirder, their weapons are powered and hull shows some minor damage. They must have just been in combat.

The vessel's captain looks up, distracted. "Huh? Oh! Well, look who it is. I thought we were all alone in these clouds. Save for the Ghosts that is. Was trying to clear out a camp of them not too far from here, bastards are stranded! I can just keep taking trips back and forth as much as I like!"

"Hah! Well, why not? Easy scrap, and makes the nebulas just a little less crowded. Once the Rebellion is out of way, the Federation will probably move a bit further out, might as well get started clearing out the riff-raff."

choice.text: Help them clear out the Ghosts.

event.text: Your offer to help delights the Federation captain. He leads you to the Ghost camp, where you spot out your target.

choice.text: Attack one of the Mantis wrecks.

event.text: As you move in to attack the Vagabonds, you watch as the other ships move to fight the Federation vessel. Hopefully you can both pull through.

choice.text: Attack one of the Engi wrecks.

event.text: As you move in to attack the Vagabonds, you watch as the other ships move to fight the Federation vessel. Hopefully you can both pull through.

choice.text: Attack one of the Zoltan wrecks.

event.text: As you move in to attack the Vagabonds, you watch as the other ships move to fight the Federation vessel. Hopefully you can both pull through.
"Gah! What the hell are you doing?" You mute the vessel and attack.
The Federation vessel looks to be too preoccupied to notice or care about you.

event.name: GHOST_FEDMORALITY_FINISH
event.text: "Good work there! We showed those gas freaks what for-" the Federation ship is cut off as a blast from a Vagabond vessel tears their hull right in half! "Get lost, breather!" You quickly wipe out the second Ghost ship, but the Federation ship won't last much longer.
"Th-thanks. This is why we've gotta have our backs at the Federation, this galaxy is full of unprovoked dangers!"

choice.text: It's for the best. Let them die and scrap their ship.

event.text: You feel a little guilty, but these guys were hardly free of sin either. The blood of this day's murder is on your hands alone now, but you should be able to move on pretty quickly.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_ANGERY_SLUG
event.text: You're hailed by an angry Slug captain. "God damn Ghosssstssss! The nebulae are OURSSSSS! I had enough issssuesss to deal with, I can't deal with a Federation ship here too."

choice.text: Show them that you aren't messing around.

event.text: "Sssshould have known you'd try thisss. Better I desssstroy your ssship than the Ghossstsss claim it themssselvesss."
"Fine... But don't let me sssee you back here."

event.name: NEBULA_DRIFTER_CHOICE_GHOST
event.text: An abandoned wreck, lights off and seemingly-empty, drifts nearby. It doesn't respond to your hails.

You send a shot directly into the hull of the wreck, causing an explosion to erupt that sends warped metal flying. Ghosts aboard or not, it doesn't matter anymore. Unfortunately, with the debris scattered into the depths of the nebula, nothing salveagable remains.
During the salvage mission, the ship unexpectedly flickers to life! The Ghost crew stir to animation, awoken by your attempts at tearing apart their newly-earned home.
The ship remains lifeless as you break down the hull.
You intend to ignore the wreck, but it appears the Ghosts aboard intend to fight you! The ship stirs to life and its weapons come online, leaving you with only one choice; to fight.
If there are Ghosts aboard, you have no interest in waking them. You decide to spend your time on something else.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_INSANE_ROCKMEN
event.text: You're hailed by the Rock ship at this beacon as soon as you jump in. Their crew are curled up on the ground, rocking back and forth. The captain shakes the camera violently, yelling at you. "GHOOOOSTS, GHOOOOOOOSTS! ARE YOU A GHOST?"

choice.text: (Ghost Crew) Show them your Ghost crew.

event.text: The Rockman begins shrieking and smashes the camera. It doesn't take long until their weapons are live and the insane Rock crew is ready to destroy you.
The captain shrivels over in fear and begs you not to eat their stomachs. You don't believe the Ghosts are carnivorous at all, but the Rockmen clearly don't know that.
The Rockman begins to cry. "No no no no, no, NO!" He slams his fist on the table in front of him and orders his psychotic crew to pull themselves together and attack.
"Oh thank you, thank you thank you thank you..." The captain crumples into a crying heap, mumbling thank you's and other incoherent ramblings. You leave them be.

"You... You are not Ghosts? I do not believe it! We have encountered only hell-spawn here, so it is clear that only demons inhabit this sector!" You don't bother explaining that by their logic they would be Ghosts as well, because their weapons are live.
"Good good good, good... good. You be careful, the Ghosts, they're everywhere!" The Rockman bursts in a fit of psychotic laughter and ends the call. You put some distance between your two ships.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_INSANE_ROCKMEN_GHOST
event.text: The Rockman lets out a scream so high pitched you didn't think it was even possible for vocal cords to make. Suddenly, he falls over, twitches, and literally dies. Your Ghost must have given him a heart attack, if Rockmen even have hearts. With the rest of their crew too insane to do anything, you scrap the exterior of their ship.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_UPGRADERS
event.text: The beacon appears empty, but you reconsider as footsteps echo through your halls. You rush to the engine room to see 3 Ghosts bent over, examining the FTL drive.

choice.text: Fight the Ghosts before they can damage your system.

event.text: You wait and watch the Ghosts as they look over every inch of your system. Though they have no visible tools, you wonder if they're taking measurements. One of the Ghosts tinkers with the mechanism in the system, then just as suddenly as they appeared the Ghosts walk out the door and disappear. You don't know what they've done, but it almost seems as if your engines are running at higher capacity than before.

You wait and watch the Ghosts as they look over every inch of your system. Suddenly, in a violent motion, one of the Ghosts tears off a metal covering on the Multiverse drive casing, resulting in a violent explosion! You don't wait any longer and order the crew to attack.

event.name: NEBULA_VAGABOND_ORCHID
event.text: Looks like an Orchid ship, of all things, is the source of this distress beacon. One of their crew hail you - "Please help! We were sent by the Gathering to negotiate with one of the Goul clans who keep burning our colonies, but our captain was taken hostage and they won't give him back!"

You follow the Orchid ship's directions to a Vagabond war camp populated mostly by Gouls. You request to speak with their leader directly: "Does the life of this frail plant thing concern you to a degree that would drive further ambitions to seek our favor in release? If you wish for this floral being not to suffer any longer, then you must prove your worth and destroy a Dynasty vessel who has been troubling my people."
The Vagabonds direct you to a Dynasty vessel not too far. Prepare for battle!

choice.text: Refuse - just attack the Vagabonds instead.

event.text: "Predictable as always! Don't expect the life of this Orchid to persist much longer after this battle!"

The two Gouls speak back and forth for some time, but finally reach a consensus. Having frightened them with foreboding warnings of a potential Orchid invasion in collaboration with the Dynasty, the Gouls don't seem eager to keep the Orchid hostage any longer. Once safely returned, the Orchids pay you for your assistance.
You apologize to the Orchids, but these aren't matters for you to get involved in.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_ESCORT
event.text: A poorly-armed civilian ship is emitting the distress beacon. Lost and afraid, they request you escort them to their destination and protect them from the Ghosts.
The civilians thank you, and pay you some scrap as a down-payment. They promise there will be more at their final destination.
The civilians are surprised by your sudden hostility, but have no choice but to fight.
We don't have time to help every civilian dumb enough to wander into the Ghost nebula. You turn down their request and charge the FTL drive.
You arrive at your desination, but a Ghost ship is already here. You signal for the civilians to stand back while you eliminate the threat.

event.name: NEBULA_GHOST_ESCORT_DESTINATION_GOOD
event.text: The civilians thank you for your help, and pay you the rest of the scrap.

event.name: VAGABOND_SEPARATISTS
event.text: "Identity of Federation vessel confirmed. It is implied your allegiance promotes your ability to assist. Currently at large: Separatist Saboteur 'B0N-N3' and Wraith Outlaw 'Clydeo'. Have eluded capture from Harmony for too long. Request: Federation vessel holds off criminals until Engi reinforcements can arrive. Is this deal acceptable?"

"Transfering coordinates. Should your vessel fail at forcing the outlaws into surrender but still manage to eliminate them, alternative, though lesser, pay will be given. Top priority of Harmony: making sure further sabotage attempts by Separatists are unsuccessful."
The Engi hang up without another word. You know that their robotic nature and stricter culture leads to customs you might consider abrupt, but must they be so rude?

event.name: VAGABOND_SEPARATISTS_OUTLAWS
event.text: A fairly large Separatist vessel is nearby, confirming that this is the correct location. Your approach seems to have alarmed the outlaws. "Say, Bonbon, does that Federation vessel strike you as out of place?" "Your assumptions are [correct]. This Federation vessel has -recently- been in contact with [Harmony] owned vessels. Your suspicions of malcontent are [justified]."

choice.text: Do what you came here to do.

event.text: If you remember correctly, you were told by the Engi not to kill these guys if you can. You'll have to wait for the Engi to arrive or force them to surrender!

choice.text: Offer to shelter them from the Harmony.

event.text: "You wouldn't be able to do shit to help us! We're outlaws, the Federation don't want none o' us! We ain't just some normal criminals, we're fightin for the liberation of bon's people! Leave us be or do what you gotta do, I ain't dilly dallying."
If you remember correctly, you were told by the Engi not to kill these guys if you can. You'll have to wait for the Engi to arrive or force them to surrender!
As you start to depart, you're stopped again by the outlaws. "You ain't going to destroy us? Why? The Harmony not paying you enough?"

choice.text: We aren't puppets to the Harmony. We're Multiverse Renegades. We enforce the law as we see fit.

event.text: "Vigilantes? Who woulda thunk it-" The outlaw is suddenly cut off by gunfire as a Harmony ship jumps in. Looks like reinforcements arrived sooner than expected!

choice.text: Pretend you did your job and take the pay.

event.text: Once the outlaws have been captured, the Harmony ship contacts you again. "The Federation vessel has proven instrumental. Delaying outlaws raised chances of success by 75%. It is likely the Harmony will be requesting your assistance again."
You've heard the stories of the way the Harmony treats the Separatists. The Engi might be the Federation's allies, but that doesn't mean you can't stand against them.

choice.text: Conflict was not on my mind today.

event.text: "Hmmm. You're an awfully strange buncha mercenaries..."
It's not a good idea to go through with this when they've already called you out. You slink away into the distant nebulas far away from the beacon.

event.name: VAGABOND_TRASHKING
event.text: This beacon contains an immense amount of pollution, with various chunks of debris stuck in its orbit. Even outside of the planet is a concerningly large concentration of trash.

choice.text: Try and pick up some of the debris.

event.text: You start to collect the scrap when you're stopped by a Vagabond ship. "Halt! All that which is not living and enters the bounds of this orbit is that which belongs to our lord, the trash king!"

"Do not tell us you have not caught word of the trash king's rule!" When their cry is met by a blank stare on your end, the Ghost seems to deflate. "Alright. Follow me." The Ghost leads you to a massive castle built entirely out of garbage, and into a grand throne room.
You are met by a large Mare Alpha wearing a paper mache crown that barely manages to stay on his gaseous 'head'. "I, am the trash king! Bow before me breathers!"
"Good. You please me. If you are wishing to leave this place hands full of my precious trash, you must prove thineself in gladiatorial combat!"

choice.text: Fight one of his strongest ships.

event.text: "A challenge! So let it be! Call forth my champions!" The trash king ushers for one of his strongest ships to fight you.

choice.text: Fight one of his weaker ships.

event.text: "A challenge! So let it be!" The trash king ushers for one of his vessels to fight you.
The trash king growls. "I said BOW!"
"Good. You please me. If you are wishing to leave this place hands full of my precious trash, you must prove thineself in gladiatorial combat!"

choice.text: Fight one of his strongest ships.

event.text: "A challenge! So let it be! Call forth my champions!" The trash king ushers for one of his strongest ships to fight you.

choice.text: Fight one of his weaker ships.

event.text: "A challenge! So let it be!" The trash king ushers for one of his vessels to fight you.

choice.text: Don't tell us what to do!

event.text: You arm the weapons and attack the Ghosts.
You content yourself with watching the Ghosts scurry about as you do something onboard the ship. You can't help but notice, however, that the clouds in the distance seem to be approaching fast...

event.name: VAGABOND_STORM
event.text: This beacon might not be near any immediate nebulas other than those far off in the north, but it does have a large Vagabond camp set up on the nearby planet. Brief scans show the inhabitants are moving about quickly.

You're undisturbed by the Ghosts as you land on the planet, but as you approach the camp one of them stops you. "Why have you come? The great northern storm drifts closer every minute! Their electric fields will decimate our computers. We advise you leave at once!"

choice.text: Offer to stay and help move their equipment.

event.text: "You wish to help? Then we will not impede you - so long as you understand the risk." You order your crew to start dragging the various equipment, like moisture farms, solar panels, and an express coffee maker, indoors. The Ghosts weren't lying either, you can see the clouds moving closer at a concerning rate.

Your crew hurry inside the shelter set up by the Ghosts. The storm eventually envelops the entire planet, and for almost an entire day you're stuck inside with the foul scented Ghosts. Still, they couldn't be happier to have you as their guests. When the storm eventually does clear, they give you one of their finest weapons as a gift.

You order the crew to keep working, even as most of the Ghosts retreat inside. By the time the clouds consume the planet, trapping you in total darkness, you stumble your way into the shelter but notice one of your crew is missing! You're stuck inside for almost a day with the Ghosts, who at least prove to be charismatic hosts.

When you're finally free, you search everywhere for your crew but can't find them. Looks like they're gone for good. Their sacrifice wasn't entirely in vain however, as your efforts saved the Ghosts most of their vital equipment. Knowing the toll the day has had on you, they offer a large amount of scrap and one of their finest weapons.

removeCrew.text: If your crew are dead, it hardly matters. The Clone Bay would have been powered off by the storm and unable to clone them regardless.

event.text: This storm is going to be devastating, and you can't risk being stuck in it. Unfortunately, you're too late. A powerful shockwave strikes your ship, crippling the engines and causing an electrical fire. Even worse, looks like a Dynasty ship, forced all the way out here by the storm's movement, is here as well now!

You receive only a brief response from the Ghosts. "A storm approaches fast. It is imperative we relocate. It is advisable you leave soon." You aren't so sure about the legitimacy of this claim, but you won't be able to do much else with the Ghosts here anyways.
You content yourself with watching the Ghosts scurry about as you do something onboard the ship. You can't help but notice, however, that the clouds in the distance seem to be approaching fast...

event.name: GHOST_REBEL_TRUCE
event.text: A Rebel ship already occupies this beacon, but surprisingly they hail you instead of fighting. "I should attack you... but this sector is littered with Ghosts and we've finally caught a break from the clouds."
"Good, glad to see we can both agree on something." You sense it's awkward for the both of you to be here, but you decide to take your mind off it by doing something else.
The Rebel captain yells at you as you both prepare for combat, "This is why the Federation must fall!"

choice.text: Pay them to delay the fleet.

event.text: The Rebel captain isn't sure how to respond, but it's clear he doesn't want to turn down the scrap. Reluctantly he accepts, and promises to give the fleet false information when they return.

event.name: UNLOCK_GHOST_QUEST
event.text: A Rebel Marauder, painted white with a strange logo on the back, hails you. "Greetings, traveler! We are the Ghost... uh... Spook Chasers! We have a unique proposition for you..."

"Maybe you've heard of the Dynasty's scuffle with the Rebellion? Well, it all went down when they took out one of the Rebels' first Flagship prototypes! This instigated a large scale war, and bla bla bla... Thing is, that Flagship is still around! In fact, it's in this very sector!"

"Now, you're probably thinking we're some Rebels. Wrong! Used to roll with that pack, but we ain't any more. We're mercenaries, and we were sent by the Federation to take out this goliath. Turns out it's in the hands of the Vagabonds now - more specifically a clan called the Haunts, led by some jackass who calls himself Goziodeon. Help us take out these sons o' bitches, and we'll split the bounty half and half. Deal?"
"Perfect! We'll transfer the last known co-ordinates of the ship. See you there."
The captain mutters something under his breath. "Fine, we'll find some other ship who's willing to kill some silly ship in return for the largest bounty ever made in galactic history!"

choice.text: A Rebel ship is a Rebel ship. Attack!

event.text: The only good Rebel is a dead Rebel. You prepare to attack.
You don't care to deal with wackos, especially out here. You hear the captain sigh as you end the call.

event.name: GHOSTBUSTER_KILL
event.text: As the ship explodes, you feel a menacing presence as hundreds of whispy shapes float out of the hull. You've probably done something really bad, but what does one cursed timeline mean anyways?

event.name: UNLOCK_GHOST_QUEST_2
event.text: You arrive at the beacon, but there is seemingly no ship here. You stare long into the clouds and catch the sight of an orange tail-wing slipping through.

You slip through the nebulas after it, only to find a massive gap in the clouds where there resides, right in the center, the old Rebel Flagship. "Good, good, you made it! Now give us a hand, would you?", shout the Spook Chasers, as they fire on the Flagship to no avail.
You're no coward. If you want to have any hope of defeating a real, multiverse traveling Flagship at the end of this mission, you should be able to take this one out as well.

event.name: UNLOCK_GHOST_QUEST_WIN
event.text: The gargantuan ship, for which you've heard so many legends about, finally gives one last quake before an explosion in the engines causes it to erupt into flames and explode. The Flagship, and the Vagabonds with it, is dead... yet again.

The Ghost Hunter hails you. "That. Was. LEGENDARY! Do you know how rich we're gonna be? Wait, yes yes. Your payment. Considering the bounty from this will be enough for us to buy an entire moon, maybe even a small planet, I suppose it doesn't hurt to give you something extra-special. We have a new cruiser that we've been working on, and I couldn't think of anyone else more worthy of piloting it than you."

"Oh, oh! One last thing. With this we'll never have to work another day in our lives. It does me no harm to pass this onto you now. More members of the haunt still roam this galaxy, and you're as good a choice as any to take the rest of them out!"
